content: In the novel "The Joy Luck Club," there has been only one Joy Luck Club. It is a mahjong club formed by four Chinese immigrant women living in San Francisco, California. The club serves as a source of support, comfort, and friendship for the women, who use it as a space to discuss their experiences and reminisce about their lives in China. The club is also a central theme in the novel, as it provides a backdrop for the relationships between the mothers and their daughters, who are all American-born.
